meanings.definition: Buffalos (noun): large, powerful mammals with horns and a shaggy coat
meanings.sent1: The buffalos grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a herd of buffalos at the national park.
meanings.sent3: The buffalos decided to have a dance party in the field.
meanings.sent4: The buffalos' strength was like a mountain in the grasslands.
meanings.sent5: The image of the buffalos running across the plains stayed with me.

meanings.sent1: The complex instructions buffalos me, making me feel lost.
meanings.sent2: His sudden outburst buffalos everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The tricky riddle buffalos the clever fox.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events buffalos our well-laid plans.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence buffalos the usually chatty group.

meanings.definition: Buffalos (adjective): relating to or resembling a buffalo
meanings.sent1: She wore a buffalos-themed sweater to the wildlife sanctuary.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a buffalos sculpture for the museum exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The buffalos-patterned wallpaper gave the room a wild touch.
meanings.sent4: His buffalos-like strength impressed everyone at the competition.
meanings.sent5: The buffalos horn-shaped handles on the cabinet were unique.
